Package game

Class AbstractDoubleBonus

java.lang.Object
game.AbstractVariant
game.AbstractDoubleBonus
All Implemented Interfaces:
IVariant
Direct Known Subclasses:
DoubleBonus107
public abstract class AbstractDoubleBonus extends AbstractVariant
Abstract class that extends the AbstractVariant class. Contains useful methods for implementing poker variants of the Double Bonus type, for example, checking what cards the player should hold and updating statistics. Different Double Bonus variants just have to implement their own payout table.
Author:
Diogo Martins, Jose Brito, Xavier Fernandes

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class game.AbstractVariant

    payTable, statsTable, totalHands

    • checkSameSuit

      private boolean checkSameSuit(Suit[] suit, int start_idx, int end_idx)
      Checks whether cards have the same rank within certain indices
      Parameters:
      suit - Array of the player's cards' suits, ordered by suit
      start_idx - Start index
      end_idx - End index
      Returns:
      boolean - True if suit is same, false otheriwse

    • checkHighCards

      private int checkHighCards(Rank[] rank, int start_idx, int end_idx)
      Checks the number of high cards in the player's hand between indices
      Parameters:

      Returns:

    • getOriginalIndexes

      private int[] getOriginalIndexes(Hand sortedHand, Hand unsortedHand, int[] sortedIndexes)
      Gets original hand indices, necessary due to reordering of the player's hand
      Parameters:
      sortedHand - Hand sorted by either rank or suit
      unsortedHand - Original hand before sorting
      sortedIndexes - Sorted indices of the hand
      Returns:
      int[] - Indices of cards to hold on unsorted hand
